item.title: A Launch Day Update from Caged Element & Wired Productions
item.description:
Hey folks.

Today we officially launched Warhammer 40,000: Speed Freeks on Steam, and whilst the game is now officially out of Early Access, we know the transition has not gone smoothly for many of you.

Connectivity problems caused by our shift from dedicated servers to a player-hosted system have made it difficult for players to find and join matches consistently. We deployed an update shortly after launch today in an attempt to address some of these issues, but unfortunately it did not resolve the core problems.

The development team is working through the night to bring the game back to full online functionality as soon as possible and fully focused on identifying and implementing a reliable fix.

We‚Äôre hugely grateful to the community for your patience, feedback, and support. Every bug report and shared log is helping us move faster towards a solution.

We‚Äôll continue to provide regular updates as work progresses. Please do continue to report bugs, issues and any hiccups you have had so far & we'll continue to answer questions in the discussions as we see them.

Thank for your your patience.

item.title: HOTFIX for Connection Issues
item.description:
Back again - hopefully with good news...



This latest patch should fix some network/connectivity issues in the launch build, as well as the game trying to join full matches when it should not.

There's still an issue with seeing games in other regions than your own, but if there's a game up in your region with space to join, you should be able to join it

If you can't seem to join a game in your region that is showing in the browser, please restart the game. This should only be necessary to do once, after loading the new update for the first time



We are still looking into fixing the issue with not being able to see/join games that are outside of your region

Apologies for the issues and we hope everyone's been having a great time, regardless ÀêsteamfacepalmÀê

We'll update again once we've done something more with it. Thanks for playing and sticking with the game!

item.title: Lex Imperialis is coming out on June 24, 2025, and Season Pass II is announced!
item.description:
Bring Justice to the Koronus Expanse with Lex Imperialis Expansion!

Lex Imperialis, the second major expansion for Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader, thrusts players into the iron grip of Imperial Law. A new 15-hour storyline introduces the Adeptus Arbites, a faction of incorruptible enforcers, and a new companion ‚Äî the grim and relentless Solomorne Anthar. With battle Familiars like cybernetic eagles and cyber-mastiffs, this DLC enriches the gameplay and narrative layers of Rogue Trader and will be available to all players on June 24, 2025.



https://store.steampowered.com/app/3622820/Warhammer_40000_Rogue_Trader__Lex_Imperialis/

New Stories Come to Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader with Season Pass 2

Also announced is Season Pass 2 for Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader, bundling two new expansions and an appearance customization pack.

  • The third major addition to the game will allow players to enter a Necron vault curated by the iconic Trazyn the Infinite, challenge ancient guardians, and uncover relics tied to the Von Valancius legacy.
  • The fourth one will let them explore the Processional of the Damned ‚Äî a surreal voidship graveyard, in a descent into madness and mystery.

Each of these DLCs will feature a new companion character, new quests deeply integrated into the main storyline, new mechanics, and deliver around 15 hours of gameplay.




https://store.steampowered.com/app/3650060/Warhammer_40000_Rogue_Trader__Season_Pass_2/
